intro: Acinodendron buxifolium, commonly known as the box-leaved acinodendron, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage with leaves resembling those of boxwood, hence its common name. It produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
